[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The EVLA Correlator defines astronomical data processing requirements, ensuring secure data acquisition, transformation, and transfer in the EVLA system.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: EVLA enables data input, Fourier Transforms, and fault-tolerant output, integrating with Correlator, M&C, and e2e systems.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: EVLA connects with Correlator, M&C, and e2e for lag frame acquisition and monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: EVLA provides restricted access via ground terminals and web tools for diagnostics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: EVLA interacts with telescope hardware for processing and diagnostics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: EVLA supports RTOS and secure data transmission protocols for mission-critical processing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: EVLA encrypts command and telemetry transmission between subsystems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: EVLA ensures 99.9% uptime with redundancy and error detection.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: EVLA is configurable for diverse observational setups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: EVLA integrates with auxiliary data processing and analysis services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 MISSING-TAG2: EVLA uses high-speed memory buffers for lag frame processing.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: EVLA processes astronomical data, performs Fourier Transforms, and ensures fault-tolerant transmission.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for astronomers, engineers, and technicians familiar with signal processing.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: EVLA assumes Correlator provides lag frames, M&C ensures monitoring, and e2e supports output rates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 MISSING-TAG1: EVLA relies on stable network infrastructure, clock synchronization, and continuous Correlator input.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall interface with Correlator for lag frame acquisition (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall ensure encrypted data transfer between M&C and e2e systems (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall convert lag frames into time-series data using Fourier Transforms.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall notify M&C of data transfer interruptions or anomalies (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide diagnostic tools for engineers.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall handle up to 1.6 GB/s input and 25 MB/s output rates (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The architecture shall support modular scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with EVLA guidelines and standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall support dynamic scalability for processing loads.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall generate error logs for debugging.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-DB-001: The database shall store metadata and auxiliary datasets.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-DB-002: The database shall ensure redundancy for critical datasets.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional and compliance tests to validate performance and reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, manuals, and troubleshooting documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: RTOS, EVLA guidelines, and Fourier Transform protocols.
